ygData.subject: RE: Sean.Clark@UCHSC.edu
ygData.msgSnippet: Just a question....if he should win in small claims....would the ruling be payable in EQ plat?
ygData.messageBody:
Just a question....if he should win in small claims....would the ruling
be payable in EQ plat?

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Steven Cobb [SMTP:cobb@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, August 04, 1999 2:13 PM
> To: EQCheats@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [EQCheats] Sean.Clark@...
>
> From: Steven Cobb <cobb@...>
>
> That is the part that truely amazes me. Besides the fact that he
> actually told the
> entire world about it as well. Lemac's email details actually what his
> lawyer should
> have told him to the first place.
>
> I think all this sean guy has to do to win the case now is just walk
> in to court with
> printouts of this thread. Might even be evidence for a counter suit.
> (Mental anguish
> and lost wages seems to be a popluar cry for money) It would be
> interesting (once
> again if we cared) to find out how that would turn out if it actually
> ever happened.
>
> "Kazen, Marc" wrote:
> >
> > From: "Kazen, Marc" <Marc.Kazen@...>
> >
> > How can he charge a proof-reading fee if he never read it?
> > Marc Kazen
> >
> >Subject: Re: [EQCheats] Sean.Clark@...
> >
> >From: Steven Cobb <cobb@...>
> >
> >Lemme get this straight, someone was sending him email that
> > he didn't want (spam?)
> >and in an effort to stop it told the guy that he would
> > charge him a fee for reading
> >his email. THEN doesn't read the email that was sent to him
> > and is planning on going
> >to small claims court to get the fee? THEN he spams us about
> > it like we cared?
> >
> >I agree with the others on the list, Nick is silly indeed.
> > Amazes me how people
> >refuse to use something as simple as a killist and think
> > this method would be a
> >better solution.
> >
> >> Nick wrote:
> >>
> >> Well, I warned this person to stop emailing me. As per my
> >> lawyers request I had
> >> warned him before not to email me or a proof reading fee
> >> would be exempted to his
> >> university/his parents. He sent me an email this morning
> >> that was lengthy and I
> >> didn't even bother reading it. Again (to the people of
> >> the list), do not send me
> >> private emails. Mr. Clark is going to have to go to small
> >> claims court because of his actions.
>
